briefTitle: A Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Brivaracetam in Study Participants (>=16 to 80 Years of Age) With Epilepsy
officialTitle: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Multicenter, Parallel-group Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Adjunctive Brivaracetam in Subjects (>=16 to 80 Years of Age) With Partial Seizures With or Without Secondary Generalization
conditions: Partial Seizures With or Without Secondary Generalization
summary: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the efficacy of brivaracetam (BRV) compared to placebo (PBO) as adjunctive treatment in subjects (\>=16 to 80 years of age) with partial seizures with or without secondary generalization despite current treatment with 1 or 2 concomitant antiepileptic drugs (AEDs) and to assess the safety and tolerability of BRV in subjects \>= 16 years to 80 years of age.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: From start of the Treatment Period (Week 0) until Safety Visit (up to Week 18); only for OLTP- From last visit of Transition Period to beginning of MAP (up to 4 Years 10 Months)
